Method Detail

remove

void remove(Node node)
Remove the node node from the graph together with any edges which have an endpoint in node.

  • Subsequent calls to Node.out() for the node will return null.
  • Subsequent use of attribute data for the node will fail with an IndexOutOfBoundsException

    • Parameters:
    node - the node to remove from the graph.

genNodes

java.util.List<Node> genNodes(int n)
Generate n new nodes for this graph.

Parameters:
n - the number of nodes to generate

Each new node will work seemlessly with managed attributes. Ad Hoc attributes in the form of native arrays should not be used after nodes are generated, as they may return spurious data or give an IndexOutOfBoundsException.

Returns:
a list of the resulting nodes in order of increasing value for Node.nodeId().

genNode

Node genNode()
Generate a single new node for this graph.

Returns:
the new node.

genEdge

Edge genEdge(Node u,
             Node v)
Generate a new edge for this graph, such that the edge's Edge.source() method returns u and the edge's Edge.target() method returns v.

Parameters:
u - one endpoint of the edge, the starting endpoint if the edge is directed.
v - another endpoint of the edge, the ending endpoint if the edge is directed.

remove

void remove(Edge edge)
Remove the edge from the graph.

Once the method is complete, the edge's Edge.source() and Edge.target() methods will continue to point to the source and target node objects, but the Edge.edgeId() method will return -edgeId() - 1 and attempts to get or set attributes will fail with an IndexOutOfBoundsException.

Parameters:
edge - the edge to be removed from the graph.

relink

void relink(Edge e)
Re-add a removed edge.

moveEdge

void moveEdge(Edge e,
              Node u,
              Node v)
Move an edge specifying the new endpoints.

At the end of this method call, the edge's Edge.source() method will return u, the edge's Edge.target() method will return v, and the edge will be accessible via the appropriate adjacency iteration methods.

This method does not necessarily make an edge directed, an undirected edge will retain the undirected semantics.

Parameters:
e - the edge to be moved.
u - the new source endpoint
v - the new target endpoint.

sortEdges

void sortEdges(java.util.Comparator<Edge> cmp)
Sort the edges in the graph.

The edges are sorted so that the outgoing (or adjacent for undirected graphs) edges of a node are guaranteed to fall in a particular order.

Parameters:
cmp - a comparator for sorting the edges.

ensureCapacity

void ensureCapacity(int n,
                    int m)
Attempt to ensure the underlying representation has room for n nodes and m edges. If the implementation is able to, it is to preallocate the storage. Any managed attribute maps are to have the storage allocated as well.

Parameters:
n - the number of nodes for which to create storage.
m - the number of edges for which to create storage.

trimToSize

void trimToSize()
Ensure that the underlying representation uses minimal space.

If the graph is not already trimmed, this operation will invalidate ad-hoc attribute maps.

See Also:
stixar.graph.attr.GraphAttrCollection

clear

void clear()
Clear all nodes and edges from the graph.
